summary: Email correspondence between attorneys regarding the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell. The email discusses providing notice of court proceedings to a newly added statutory victim under the Crime Victim Rights Act and informs about upcoming court appearances, including an arraignment and a bail appeal oral argument.

persons.name: Jack Scarola
persons.context: Attorney receiving and sending emails regarding court proceedings and victim notifications in the Ghislaine Maxwell case. He is copied on scheduling updates.

persons.name: Michael Danchuk
persons.context: Assistant United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York who sends the initial email regarding victim notifications and upcoming court dates in the Maxwell case.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case 'United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell'. The email discusses her upcoming arraignment and bail appeal.

persons.name: Judge Nathan
persons.context: The judge who scheduled an in-person arraignment for Ghislaine Maxwell on April 23, 2021.

connections.description: Prosecutor (Danchuk) communicates with attorney (Scarola) regarding victim notifications and court scheduling in the Maxwell case.
Danchuk, as an AUSA, is prosecuting the case against defendant Ghislaine Maxwell.
Judge Nathan is presiding over the arraignment and other proceedings in the criminal case against Maxwell.

events.title: Arraignment on Superseding Indictment
events.description: In-person arraignment for Ghislaine Maxwell scheduled by Judge Nathan at 2:30 p.m. in courtroom 24B at 500 Pearl Street.

events.title: Bail Appeal Oral Argument
events.description: The Second Circuit scheduled a remote oral argument regarding Ghislaine Maxwell's bail appeal for 10 a.m.

locations: 500 Pearl Street, courtroom 24B (location of Maxwell's arraignment)
keyFacts: A superseding indictment has been filed adding a new statutory victim to the case against Ghislaine Maxwell.
The prosecution intends to provide notice of court proceedings to this victim pursuant to the Crime Victim Rights Act.
An in-person arraignment for Ghislaine Maxwell is scheduled for April 23, 2021, before Judge Nathan.
The Second Circuit has scheduled a remote oral argument for Maxwell's bail appeal on April 26, 2021.
The email correspondence indicates ongoing legal coordination between the prosecution and other attorneys regarding victim rights and court scheduling.
